    Revenue, Department of

    Revenue Agent
    Job Announcement Code(s): 19-02835

    County(ies):
    Dane

    Classification Title: / JAC:
    Job Working Title:
    REVENUE AGENT 19-02835
    Revenue Agent

    Type of Employment:
    Full Time (40 hrs/week)

    Salary:
    Starting salary will be $20.29 per hour. Current state employees' pay will be set in accordance with pay upon appointment provisions for the compensation plan for broadband 07-04. An eighteen-month probationary period is required.

    Contact:
    Wanda Anthony, Human Resources Specialist - Senior, 608-266-2679, wanda.anthony@wisconsin.gov

    Bargaining Unit:
    Non-Represented

    Area of Competition:
    Open

    Deadline to Apply:
    10/13/2019


    Assessment Information:
    67571 - 023 REVENUE AGENT
    Preview Assessment




    The Department of Revenue is recruiting to fill multiple Revenue Agent positions in our Tax Operations Bureau. These positions are located in our Madison office. If you enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, please consider applying for these challenging and rewarding positions. For information on state benefits click here.

    Position Summary:
    Responsible for document processing and customer service related to processing, which includes resolving taxpayer objections to adjustment notices; providing customer service to taxpayers; and processing exception work items produced by the processing computer system (WINPAS). These positions are also involved in the annual testing project. These positions require a high degree of independence, initiative, technical knowledge and ability to communicate across the organization.

    Special Notes:

    Please reference General Information about Jobs in WI State Government. The department will conduct a background check, tax compliance and finger printing check on all finalist. Interview results may be reused in accordance with the State of Wisconsin interview reuse policy.Applicants must be eligible to work in the United States. The Department of Revenue does not sponsor work or student visas, either at time of hire or at any later time.

    Qualifications:

    Please address the following in your letter of qualification and résumé:

    Minimally qualified candidates will have:

  • Experience providing customer service verbally or in writing.

  • Document processing experience using written procedures and guidelines.

  • Effective written and verbal communication skills.


    • Well qualified candidates will have all of the above, plus the following

  • Experience working with tax laws.

  • Experience with research techniques and resources.

  • Experience applying laws, codes and/or policies.


Starting salary will be $20.29 per hour. Current state employees' pay will be set in accordance with pay upon appointment provisions for the compensation plan for broadband 07-04. An eighteen-month probationary period is required.

    Natural Resources, Department of

    Fish, Wildlife, and Parks Communication Specialist
    Job Announcement Code(s): 19-02814

    County(ies):
    Dane

    Classification Title: / JAC:
    Job Working Title:
    COMMUNICATIONS SPECIALIST - ADVANCED 19-02814
    Fish, Wildlife, an Parks Communication Specialist

    Type of Employment:
    Full Time (40 hrs/week)

    Salary:
    Starting pay is between $75,504 and $80,267 annually ($36.30 - $38.59) per hour). depending on experience and qualifications. Pay on appointment for current or former state employees may vary according to the applicable pay transaction provisions of the Compensation Plan. Current State employees applying as a transfer applicant will require DPM approval for pay on transfer increases. Please contact the HR Specialist for more information. This position is in Pay Schedule/ Range 07-03.

    Contact:
    Rebecca Rupnow, Human Resources Specialist, 608-261-6447, Rebecca.Rupnow@Wisconsin.gov

    Bargaining Unit:
    Non-Represented

    Area of Competition:
    Open

    Deadline to Apply:
    10/10/2019
    All materials must be complete and finalized by 11:59 pm CDT on the deadline date. Once you have finalized, changes can not be made to your application.

    Assessment Information:
    12363 - 055 COMMUNICATIONS SPECIALIST - ADVANCED
    Preview Assessment




    The Department of Natural Resources is hiring a Fish, Wildlife, and Parks Outreach and Communication Specialist in the Communications Specialist- Advanced classification within the Division of Fish, Wildlife, and Parks. This position will be stationed in Madison.

    The Wisconsin DNR is located at 101 S. Webster Street in the heart of downtown Madison, near the state capitol, the Madison Metro bus route and the Capital City bike path. In addition, there are many nearby restaurants and shopping venues. In partnership with individuals and organizations, the DNR staff manage fish, wildlife, forests, parks, air, and water resources while promoting a healthy, sustainable environment and a full range of outdoor activities.

    In addition to many appealing benefits, the DNR offers a fun, casual work environment, flexible scheduling (depending on the position), and opportunities for career development. The DNR is an inclusive, diverse agency that prides itself on commitment to sustainability and giving back to the community by participating in fund raisers for charities. Come join the Department of Natural Resources where you can contribute to rewarding and meaningful work! Additionally, you may be eligible for the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program! Click here, for additional information about State Government positions.


    Position Summary:

    This position is responsible for managing division-wide emerging communication related issues, as related to state and/or federal legislation and policy as well as special projects assigned by the Division of Fish, Wildlife and Parks. The Fish, Wildlife, and Parks Communication Specialist coordinates cross-divisional and inter-divisional communication related projects and processes as well as serves as the primary Division liaison to the Office of Communication. This position also broadly coordinates marketing efforts for the Division and serves as a liaison to the Department's R3 program. The Fish, Wildlife, and Parks Communication Specialist plays a lead role in ensuring program integration, issue management, program evaluation, strategic planning, organizational development and division-wide communications as they relate to consumptive and non-consumptive outdoor recreation.

    To view the complete position description, click here.

    Special Notes:

    Employment will require the selected candidate to pass a background check. DNR does not sponsor work visas, thus, in compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify eligibility to work in the United States by completing the required I-9 form upon hire.

    Qualifications:

    In order to be minimally qualified for this position, required qualifications include education or experience in:

  • Leading a team of individuals and coordinating and collaborating as a team.
  • Development of policy including drafting of policy documents, presenting for review, development of implementation plans and conducting implementation oversight to ensure consistent program delivery.
  • Creating written publications for use in marketing and translating complex information to the general public in non-technical terms.

    • In addition to the required qualifications, preferred qualifications for this position include:

  • Experience creating digital content such as photography, photo editing, videography, video editing, social media, podcasts, and other digital communication tools.
  • Direct work experience (paid or unpaid) in the areas of Natural Resources Management, Recreation Management, Fisheries Management, Wildlife Management or related field.


Starting pay is between $75,504 and $80,267 annually ($36.30 - $38.59) per hour). depending on experience and qualifications. Pay on appointment for current or former state employees may vary according to the applicable pay transaction provisions of the Compensation Plan. Current State employees applying as a transfer applicant will require DPM approval for pay on transfer increases. Please contact the HR Specialist for more information. This position is in Pay Schedule/ Range 07-03.

This is a full-time position with the Department of Revenue. For more information on the Department of Revenue, please visit http://dor.sd.gov.

This position will conduct gaming revenue tax and compliance audits, enforce the rules and regulations of the South Dakota Commission on Gaming, and participate in evaluations of Casino's business practices through on-site observation programs.

This position is exempt from the Civil Service Act.

The Ideal Candidate Will Have:

Gaming accounting and/or auditing experience, experience working in collaborative team environments, and demonstrating effective time management and organizational skills with an attention to detail. Equally important will be a strong work ethic, integrity, interpersonal skills, discretion, confidentiality and a positive attitude. A high school diploma or equivalent is preferred.

Knowledge of:

  • the gaming industry;
  • Generally Accepted Accounting Principles;
  • Generally Accepted Auditing Standards;
  • effective communication techniques auditing practices;
  • Microsoft applications including Excel, Word & Outlook.

Skill to:

  • analyze gathered information, prepare detailed reports and present information;
  • use computer and software associated with position;
  • organizational and time management skills;
  • effective interpersonal skills;
  • provide professional customer service to gaming licensees;
  • evaluate business practices of casinos as required by SDCG Rules and Regulations.

Ability to:

  • understand, interpret state law, rules and regulations as they apply to South Dakota gaming activities;
  • communicate clearly and concisely;
  • gather, organize and present information effectively and in a logical sequence;
  • establish and maintain effective relationships with coworkers, other agencies and the public;
  • meet deadlines, think critically and solve problems.

Additional Requirements: Please include a resume with your application.

VETERANS' PREFERENCE ELIGIBLE

Successful applicant(s) will be required to undergo a background investigation. An arrest/conviction record will not necessarily bar employment.

NCRC: If you possess a National Career Readiness Certificate, please submit the certificate with your application. For more information on how to acquire a National Career Readiness Certificate contact a South Dakota Department of Labor and Regulation Job Service Office. A certificate is not necessary to be considered.

The State of South Dakota does not sponsor work visas for new or existing employees. All persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and complete an Employment Eligibility Verification, Form I-9.

The State of South Dakota offers paid employee health insurance plus ten paid holidays, generous vacation leave accrual, and medical, dental, vision, and other benefits. For more information please visit https://bhr.sd.gov/job-seekers/work-for-state-government/. This position is a member of Class A retirement under SDRS.

Revenue, Department of

Customer Service Representative
Job Announcement Code(s): 19-02787

County(ies):
Dane, Marathon

Classification Title: / JAC:
Job Working Title:
REVENUE TAX SPECIALIST 19-02787
Customer Service Representative

Type of Employment:
Full Time (40 hrs/week)

Salary:
Starting salary is $20.29 per hour, plus excellent benefits. Current state employees' pay will be set in accordance with pay upon appointment provisions for the compensation plan for broadband 07-04. A twelve-month probationary period is required.

Contact:
Terri Wilke, Human Resources Specialist - Senior, 608-266-3924, terri.wilke@wisconsin.gov

Bargaining Unit:
Non-Represented

Area of Competition:
Open

Deadline to Apply:
10/7/2019
11:59 p.m.

Assessment Information:
01100 - 021 REVENUE TAX SPECIALIST
Preview Assessment




At the Wisconsin Dept. of Revenue one of most important goals is to provide outstanding customer service. We are seeking energetic, customer-oriented individuals to provide telephone, written and walk-in assistance to our customers. Training on tax laws is provided.

If you believe you can contribute to our goal of excellence in service in a high volume customer service environment, please consider applying for these challenging yet rewarding positions. We have multiple vacancies in our Madison office at 2135 Rimrock Road, and one vacancy in our Wausau office located at 730 N. Third St. For information on state benefits click here.

Position Summary: These are entry level professional positions responsible for performing technical customer service activities, providing general taxpayer assistance to customers, and educating taxpayers and department staff. For a copy of the Position Description for Madison positions, click here. For a copy of the Position Description for the Wausau position, click here.

Special Notes:

Please reference General Information about Jobs in WI State Government.

The department will conduct a background check, fingerprinting check, and tax compliance check prior to making an offer to hire. Interview results may be reused in accordance with the State of WI interview reuse policy.

Applicants must be eligible to work in the United States. The Department of Revenue does not sponsor work or student visas, either at time of hire or at any later time.

Qualifications:

    Please address the following in your cover letter and résumé:

    Minimally qualified candidates will have:
  • Experience providing customer service by phone, in person and/or in writing
  • Experience using Microsoft Office Products (e.g., Word, Outlook, Excel)
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills

    • Well-qualified candidates will also have:
  • Experience researching complex technical issues
  • Training experience
  • Experience preparing income and/or business tax returns
  • Call center experience


Starting salary is $20.29 per hour, plus excellent benefits. Current state employees' pay will be set in accordance with pay upon appointment provisions for the compensation plan for broadband 07-04. A twelve-month probationary period is required.

Job Description

The Product Intern will be a member of the Visa DPS Product team and will be responsible for assisting Directors and Product Managers with product work. The Intern will be assisting with the Debit Core payment transaction processing and authorization related services.

The Product intern responsibilities include:

  • Research, reporting, process documentation, product usage analytics and all aspects of project management work.
  • This position requires the ability to apply analytical and critical thinking skills to assist in solving business problems, and to recommend solutions to improve processes and drive continuous improvements in the product lines supported.

This position will be based in Highlands Ranch, Colorado.


Qualifications

Basic Qualifications

  • Must have a High School diploma or equivalent
  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree, graduating Dec. 2020 or later

Preferred Qualifications

  • 1 or more years of work experience
  • Candidate must be working towards their BA or BS in: Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Technology, or Business Administration with an emphasis in technology strategy.
  • Strong work ethic; eager to contribute to the team’s success
  • Strong desire and aptitude to work hands-on with data and analytics
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Creative spark in working innovatively with long-established systems and processes
  • Team player who is able to work independently with general supervision

Additional Information

Work Authorization: Authorization to work in the U.S. is a precondition of employment for this position. Visa will not sponsor applicants for work visas in connection with this position.

Work Hours: This position requires the incumbent to be available during core business hours.

Travel Requirements: This position requires the incumbent to travel for work up to 5% of the time.

Mental/Physical Requirements: This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers, and reach with hands and arms.

EEO Statement: Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

WHO WE ARE:
ActBlue builds and maintains a powerful online fundraising platform for Democratic campaigns, progressive organizations, and nonprofits working to create a better future. We put power in the hands of small-dollar donors by making it easier for grassroots supporters to make their voices heard and by helping thousands of groups — from presidential candidates to environmental organizations — build people-powered movements.

We're a nonprofit organization, and our team has a big impact on the future of our country. Each and every one of us, from the political activists to the tech innovators to the customer service pros, is fully committed to our mission. We're excited to grow this team and get ready to take on even bigger challenges as we look toward 2020 and beyond.

THIS ROLE:
The Outreach Team is the primary point of contact and welcome wagon for all new campaigns and organizations that use ActBlue. We engage groups and train them to use ActBlue's tools for grassroots fundraising. Nonprofits both big and small, national and local, are able to take advantage of our entire set of cutting-edge fundraising tools. We're excited to bring our innovative platform to a whole new set of charitable organizations: There are nonprofits doing crucial work right now, and we can't wait to help them strengthen their grassroots fundraising and power their good work.

We're looking for someone with nonprofit experience who is interested in digital fundraising and online organizing. The Nonprofit Outreach Assistant will work to research nonprofits in different issue areas, identify key decision makers, maintain our visibility within the nonprofit space, and closely support the rest of the Nonprofit Outreach Team as we teach organizations about our fundraising platform and make sure that they are getting the most out of our tools.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
---------------------------

  • Identify and research new nonprofit leads.
  • Identify decision makers in nonprofits.
  • Research and organize our knowledge of nonprofits, related vendors, and their digital capacity.
  • Assist team members in maintaining nonprofit relationships.
  • Assist in maintaining the team CRM.
  • Travel to events and conferences once or twice per quarter to represent ActBlue and the Nonprofit Outreach Team in person.
YOU ARE:
--------

  • A networker: We are looking for team members who are outgoing and enthusiastic about outreach and building great relationships.
  • Comfortable going solo: While you'll be working in a larger team, most of your day-to-day work will be independently driven and managed.
  • Highly detailed: You proofread, reread, and triple-check your work. You understand that details play a key role in setting a project up for success.
  • Flexible: You're adaptable and able to handle a wide range of projects as well as work with a wide variety of clients.
  • A troubleshooter: Creativity, patience, and a helpful attitude are crucial when working with nonprofits in order to make sure our tools are benefiting them as much as possible.
  • Mission-driven: Our online fundraising technology makes it easy for more supporters to make their voices heard and participate in change every day. We need people who are passionate about furthering this work and providing the best service to every organization that we work with.
  • Comfortable with travel: You don't mind traveling once or twice a quarter.
  • Bonus points: Someone who is comfortable collecting, organizing, and tidying CRMs.
LOCATION & COMPENSATION:
ActBlue's office is located in Davis Square in Somerville, MA, just a few blocks from Boston's MBTA Red Line train. This posting is for a full-time, in-office, salaried position. We offer a competitive salary and a generous compensation package, which includes commuter benefits; fully paid and trans-inclusive health, dental, and vision insurance; an employer-sponsored 401k contribution plan; and a flexible time off policy.

Salary Range: $50K - $60K based on experience level

ActBlue is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against candidates on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or veteran status. Women, people of color, LGBTQIA2S+ individuals, and members of other minority or marginalized groups are strongly encouraged to apply.

ActBlue cannot at this time sponsor work visas.

To support our project teams, we are looking for

Consultant, Undergraduate Class of 2020- USA

for our offices in the United States

About Simon-Kucher & Partners

For over 30 years, Simon-Kucher & Partners has helped growth stage to Global Fortune 500 companies in addressing their most important company challenges. We focus on TopLine Power® by helping clients grow their revenue through strategy, pricing, marketing and sales. We are regarded as the world’s leading pricing advisor and thought leader.

Globalization is a core element of our goals and strategy. Today we are an international and multilingual team of over 1,300 full-time employees from diverse academic and professional backgrounds in over 38 offices around the world.

Simon-Kucher & Partners has industry practices operating in all major areas, including Healthcare/Life Sciences, Consumer/Retail, B2B/Industrials, Financial Services, and Software/Internet/Media.

About You

We are looking for outstanding candidates to support the growth of our US businesses. You have demonstrated high academic achievement, leadership, and communication skills at a top institution. You have a high interest in consulting, especially strategy, pricing, marketing and sales, as well as have experience in quantitative analysis.

You also possess the following qualities that will contribute to our success and the success of our clients:

Problem solving skills: You effectively combine analytical skills with business acumen to structure problems, deliver solutions and communicate insights.

Entrepreneurial spirit: You are a self-starter and a finisher. You enjoy contributing to the growth of an organization. You show commitment to the success of your team.

Drive: You set ambitious goals for yourself. You are energetic, enjoy a fast paced environment and thrive in taking on responsibility.

How to Apply

Please attach all required documentation, as incomplete applications will not be reviewed:

  • Cover Letter
o Work authorization status
o Preferred start date
o Office and industry practice interest/(s)
  • Resume
o Standardized test scores
o Foreign language skills and level of fluency
o Unofficial transcript

Temporary visa sponsorship is at the discretion of Simon-Kucher & Partners LLC. At present, the company only sponsors applicants with graduate degrees.


If you would like to learn more about us, please visit www.simon-kucher.com

This is a full-time position with the Department of Agriculture. For more information about the South Dakota Department of Agriculture, please visit http://sdda.sd.gov/.

This position performs a variety of support functions including greeting customers; answering and routing phone calls, establishing and maintaining computerized and/or manual files; receipting money; data entry; imaging documents; issuing permits/certificates and product registrations.

The Ideal Candidate Will Have:

Knowledge of:

  • general office procedures;
  • Microsoft Office including Access;
  • business letter writing;
  • English grammar, spelling and punctuation.

Ability to:

  • communicate effectively;
  • operate a variety of office equipment such as photocopier, fax machine, imager/scanner, and calculator;
  • enter and retrieve data from computer systems;
  • organize work, set priorities, and meet critical deadlines;
  • establish and maintain effective working relationships with other employees and the general public;
  • interact with customers and constituents in a pleasant manner;
  • solve problems and find solutions to customer issues.

VETERANS' PREFERENCE ELIGIBLE

NCRC: If you possess a National Career Readiness Certificate, please submit the certificate with your application. For more information on how to acquire a National Career Readiness Certificate contact a South Dakota Department of Labor and Regulation Job Service Office. A certificate is not necessary to be considered.

The State of South Dakota does not sponsor work visas for new or existing employees. All persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and complete an Employment Eligibility Verification, Form I-9.

The State of South Dakota offers paid employee health insurance plus ten paid holidays, generous vacation leave accrual, and medical, dental, vision, and other benefits. For more information please visit https://bhr.sd.gov/job-seekers/work-for-state-government/. This position is a member of Class A retirement under SDRS.

Transportation, Department of

Records Support - Part Time LTE (20 hours per week)
Job Announcement Code(s): 19-02889

County(ies):
Douglas

Classification Title: / JAC:
Job Working Title:
RECORDS PROGRAM ASSOCIATE 19-02889
Limited Term - Records Support

Type of Employment:
Part Time (less than 40 hrs/week)

Salary:
This Limited Term Employment (LTE) position is in pay schedule 02- 11. Salary is $16.05 per hour. This position is part-time Monday through Friday, approximately 20 hours per week.

Contact:
Denise Foster, HR Specialist, 715-855-7665, Denise.Foster@wisconsin.gov

Bargaining Unit:
Non-Represented

Area of Competition:
Open

Deadline to Apply:
10/13/2019
Deadline to apply to this Limited Term Employment position is 11:59 PM Sunday, October 13, 2019.

Assessment Information:
23901 - 012 RECORDS PROGRAM ASSOCIATE - LTE
Preview Assessment




The Wisconsin Department of Transportation Division of Transportation System Development's Northwest Region is looking for a Records Program Associate - Limited Term Employee to assist with the Region's Records Coordinator in the Superior office located at 1701 N. 4th Street.


Position Summary: The Records Program Associate will work with the Regional Records Coordinator in identifying, sorting, moving and storing regional records and files. The successful candidate will also assist with developing and implementing the region's open records policies and procedures.

Special Notes:

WisDOT does not sponsor work visas. Any appointment made will be contingent on the applicant being able to prove valid status to work in the United States.

Prior to any appointments for position(s) filled from this announcement, candidates may be subject to a comprehensive criminal background check with may include FBI fingerprinting.

This is a Limited Term Employment (LTE) position and limited to 1,039 hours in 26 consecutive pay periods (1 year).

Wisconsin residency is required for Limited Term Employment positions.

Limited Term Employment (LTE) positions are not civil service classified positions, do not give any rights to permanent civil service classified positions and do not lead to permanent status.

NOTE: The essential functions of this position require occasional bending/stooping, reaching above the shoulder level, pushing/pulling records and the ability to lift up to 25 pounds. In addition, the ability to travel independently to region offices and or field sites outside of the headquarters may be necessary.

Qualifications:

The qualified candidate will have:


  • Ability to understand and communicate thoughts and ideas effectively.

  • Basic oral, written and communication skills, reading comprehension skills, map reading and direction orientation.

  • Ability to establish and maintain working relationships with fellow employees, administrative officials and the general public.

  • Good knowledge of office policies and procedures.

  • Ability to remain calm and functional under high-pressure conditions.

  • Excellent telephone skills.

  • Working knowledge of various computer files and software including MS Outlook, Word and Excel.

  • Keyboard skills for entering program data.

  • Basic math skills.

  • Strong organizational skills.

  • Ability to meet deadlines by prioritizing work in a highly demanding/multi-task environment.


This Limited Term Employment (LTE) position is in pay schedule 02- 11. Salary is $16.05 per hour. This position is part-time Monday through Friday, approximately 20 hours per week.
